snippet: The New York public television broadcaster said it would return the funding in the face of charges that it solicited inappropriate underwriting for the series.
abstract: New York City public television broadcaster WNET says it will return $3.5 million grant it received from Laura and John Arnold Foundation to sponsor ambitious project on public pensions in face of charges that it solicited inappropriate underwriting for series.
lead_paragraph: The New York public television broadcaster said it would return the funding in the face of charges that it solicited inappropriate underwriting for the series.

headline.main: WNET to Return $3.5 Million Grant for Pension Series
headline.print_headline: WNET to Return Grant for Pension Series
